com.picocontainer.containers

Class JSRPicoContainer

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.picocontainer.containers.AbstractDelegatingPicoContainer
      • com.picocontainer.containers.AbstractDelegatingMutablePicoContainer
        • com.picocontainer.containers.JSRPicoContainer
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Converting, Disposable, MutablePicoContainer, PicoContainer, Startable, Serializable

    public class JSRPicoContainer
extends AbstractDelegatingMutablePicoContainer
    This class requires the JSR330 JAR to be in the classpath upon load. It provides automatic key generation based on Named and Qualifier annotations. It handles JSR compliant Provider classes, and supports turning on caching for Singleton marked classes.
    Author:
    Michael Rimov
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • determineKey

        protected Object determineKey(Object implOrInstance)
        Determines the key of the object. It may have JSR 330 qualifiers or Named annotations. If none of these exist, the key is the object's class.
        Parameters:
        implOrInstance - either an actual object instance or more often a class to be constructed and injection by the container.
        Returns:
        the object's determined key.

      • getQualifier

        Retrieves the qualifier among the annotations that a particular field/method/class has. Returns the first qualifier it finds or null if no qualifiers seem to exist.
        Parameters:

      • makeChildContainer

        public MutablePicoContainer makeChildContainer()
        Description copied from interface: MutablePicoContainer
        Make a child container, using both the same implementation of MutablePicoContainer as the parent and identical behaviors as well. It will have a reference to this as parent. This will list the resulting MPC as a child. Lifecycle events will be cascaded from parent to child as a consequence of this.

        Note that for long-lived parent containers, you need to unregister child containers made with this call before disposing or you will leak memory. (Experience speaking here! )

        Incorrect Example:

           MutablePicoContainer parent = new PicoBuilder().withCaching().withLifecycle().build();
   MutablePicoContainer child = parent.makeChildContainer();
   child = null; //Child still retains in memory because parent still holds reference.

        Correct Example:

           MutablePicoContainer parent = new PicoBuilder().withCaching().withLifecycle().build();
   MutablePicoContainer child = parent.makeChildContainer();
   parent.removeChildContainer(child); //Remove the bi-directional references.
   child = null;
        Specified by:
        makeChildContainer in interface MutablePicoContainer
        Specified by:
        makeChildContainer in class AbstractDelegatingMutablePicoContainer
        Returns:
        the new child container.

      • applyInstanceAnnotations

        protected void applyInstanceAnnotations(Class<?> objectImplementation)

      • addComponent

        public JSRPicoContainer addComponent(Object key,
                            Object implOrInstance,
                            Parameter... parameters)
                              throws PicoCompositionException
        Covariant return override;
        Specified by:
        addComponent in interface MutablePicoContainer
        Overrides:
        addComponent in class AbstractDelegatingMutablePicoContainer
        Parameters:
        key - a key that identifies the component. Must be unique within the container. The type of the key object has no semantic significance unless explicitly specified in the documentation of the implementing container.
        implOrInstance - the component's implementation class. This must be a concrete class (ie, a class that can be instantiated). Or an instance of the compoent.
        parameters - the parameters that gives the container hints about what arguments to pass to the constructor when it is instantiated. Container implementations may ignore one or more of these hints.
        Returns:
        the same instance of MutablePicoContainer
        Throws:
        PicoCompositionException - if registration of the component fails.
        See Also:
        Parameter, ConstantParameter, ComponentParameter

      • addComponent

        public MutablePicoContainer addComponent(Object key,
                                Object implOrInstance,
                                ConstructorParameters constructorParams,
                                FieldParameters[] fieldParams,
                                MethodParameters[] methodParams)
        Description copied from interface: MutablePicoContainer
        Longhand method for adding components when multiple injection is used
        Specified by:
        addComponent in interface MutablePicoContainer
        Overrides:
        addComponent in class AbstractDelegatingMutablePicoContainer
        Parameters:
        key - the object key. Most often either a string or a Class.
        implOrInstance - the component's implementation class.
        constructorParams - Parameters for the constructor of the object may be zero length by using com.picocontainer.parameters.ConstructorParameters.NO_ARG_CONSTRUCTOR
        fieldParams - an array of field parameters to override Picocontainer's Autowiring capabilities.
        methodParams - an array of method parameters to override PicoContainer's autowiring capabilities.
        Returns:
        this to allow for method chaining.
